message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.HC 

This paper deals with video analysis and processing, specifically in the context of egocentric videos. The methodology proposed involves semantic information extraction from images to create a fast-forward video that is more visually appealing. This work is likely to fall under the following arXiv CS sub-categories: 

- cs.CV (Computer Vision): This sub-category deals with the analysis and processing of visual data, including images and videos. The use of semantic information extraction to create a fast-forward video aligns with the scope of this sub-category. 
- cs.MM (Multimedia): This sub-category deals with the creation, processing, and analysis of multimedia content, including videos. The focus of this paper on creating a more visually appealing video is relevant to this sub-category. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): This sub-category deals with the development and application of machine learning algorithms. The use of semantic information extraction to select frames for the fast-forward video may involve machine learning techniques, making this sub-category relevant. 
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval): This sub-category deals with the retrieval and analysis of information from large datasets. The use of semantic information extraction to select frames for the fast-forward video may involve information retrieval techniques, making this sub-category relevant.
